main event: A UFO sighting was reported near Minot, North Dakota on 17 November 1957, observed through radar equipment.
interesting points: The object climbed from 5,222 feet to 25,222 feet in twenty seconds., The radar indicated the object passed 60 miles in 20 seconds., The sighting was marked by potential radar equipment malfunction., It is concluded that the observed object might have been a false target due to mountain reflection., The report includes different possible conclusions about the nature of the object: balloon, aircraft, or astronomical.
witness description: A/2C Charles A. Wagner, 785th ACW SQ, Radar Maintenance with five months experience.
